description: Preventative maintenance for two nitrogen generators, options for 5 year contract
full_summary:
**Preventative Maintenance Service Contract for Nitrogen Generators**
==========================================

**Reference Number:** PW-22-01015522
**Publication Date:** December 1, 2022
**Closing Date:** December 30, 2022, 14:00:00

**Background**
------------

Health Canada is seeking a preventative maintenance service contract for two Parker Balston N2-80 nitrogen generators located in room A410 of the Sir Frederick G. Banting Research Centre in Ottawa, Ontario.

**Objective**
----------

The primary objective of this requirement is to obtain a preventative maintenance contract that covers the maintenance of the two nitrogen generators for the 2022-23 fiscal year, with options to extend the contract for an additional 4 years.

**Contract Scope**
----------------

The successful contractor must provide maintenance services outlined in the Statement of Work (SOW), section 3.1, for the two nitrogen generators. The contractor is also required to provide options to carry out the maintenance for an additional 4 years.

**Eligibility**
--------------

Eligible suppliers must be authorized to sell and provide maintenance services for laboratory equipment in Canada.

**Contact Information**
-------------------

For more information, please contact Wesley Phillips, Contracting Authority, at wesley.phillips@canada.ca or 613-941-2067.

**Attachments**
-------------

The solicitation documents and instruction can be downloaded from the Canada Buys website:

- English version: https://canadabuys.canada.ca/documents/pub/att/2022/12/01/9839be40feb02eed267f371104c949f6/pr1000245094_rfp_final_english.docx
- French version: https://canadabuys.canada.ca/documents/pub/att/2022/12/01/994e1f4bba891ad6859e1790e937e9f6/pr1000245094_rfp_final_french.docx

**Important Information**
-----------------------

The tender closing date is December 30, 2022, at 14:00:00. It is the supplier's responsibility to ensure that their bid is submitted on time. Late bids will not be accepted. 

The solicitation documents and any amendments will be available for download from the Canada Buys website. It is the supplier's responsibility to regularly check the site for updates.
